ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] adding seeds through bean browser doesn't work in heritrix 3.3 snapshot
ygData.msgSnippet: The example at https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Browse+Beans was misleading. Adding seeds via Browse Beans has no useful effect. I removed

The example at
https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Browse+Bea=
ns was
misleading. Adding seeds via "Browse Beans" has no useful effect. I =
removed
that from the wiki page.

As Gordon explained, the best way to add =
seeds mid-crawl is by dropping a
file with the extension .seeds into the "a=
ction directory" of your crawl
job.
https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/arc=
hive-crawler/conversations/messages/8537

Noah


On Thu, Jun 19, 2014 at 1:=
49 AM, src_psu@... [archive-crawler] <
archive-crawler@...=
m> wrote:

>
>
> I was trying to follow the example mentioned in
> https://=
webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Browse+Beans
>
>
> . So I am tryi=
ng to add a seed to an already running job. Isn't that
> possible? Let's sa=
y I had http://a.b.c.d as the value of
> seeds.textsource.value and I chang=
ed it to http://a.b.c.d http://a.b.c.d
> http://e.f.g.h. It should crawl th=
e second site, right?
>
> Also, does the changes made to  any of the existi=
ng beans via "browse
> beans" option get reflected in an already running jo=
b?
>
>
>
> 
>

--089e010d8be8cc8c4304fc85bb90
